meanings.sent1: I need to regest my new address with the post office.
meanings.sent2: The librarian will regest the borrowed books in the system.
meanings.sent3: I forgot to regest my attendance, so now I have to explain it to the teacher.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so bright that it seemed to regest in everyone's memory.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell regested through the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: A list or record of items.
meanings.sent1: The regest of attendees showed a full house for the event.
meanings.sent2: She kept a regest of all the books she wanted to read.
meanings.sent3: The regest of ingredients for the recipe was missing the main spice.
meanings.sent4: His eyes scanned the regest of names, searching for his own.
meanings.sent5: The regest of achievements on the wall motivated the students to aim higher.
